category.item:
By applying BBcodes, USK (Entertainment software self-control) logos can be added within a text respectively thread. The way this works will be explained in the following.
The USK logos serve for a visual and explicit highlighting of all those contents, needing a clear marking due to legal requirements. Accordingly, by applying them one can show e.g. whether a computergame is also allowed to be played by a 16-year-old player or if s/he has to be 18 to do so.

These are SVG-data, which can be individually scaled due to their structure. By doing so, no optic and/or qualitative differences occur and using respectively editing them can be easily managed.

By inserting $age one of the five defined age statements can be chosen. These are: 0, 6, 12, 16 or 18 years.

By inserting$size the wished for pixel number can be adjusted. It can lay within the range of 10-999 pixel(s). Here is an example displayed in the size of 128px:

If the size is not specified, the standard size of 64x64 pixels will be automatically chosen and displayed. It looks like this:

The Syntax - Basic Structure

The USK-BBcodes basic structure is composed like this:
[usk(='$age')(,'$size')]$age[/usk]
The feature of $age within the BBcodes is obligatory. If no age is inserted, the BBcode will not be displayed.
There are two options to define the age:
[usk]$age[/usk]
or [usk='$age'][/usk]

If you want to define an additional size, you do always have to use the second type of structure:
[usk='$age','$size'][/usk]

Examples:

[usk]0[/usk]


[usk='0'][/usk]


[usk='0','128'][/usk]
